sourceMeaningMnemonic: You need to put a <radical>clown</radical> in the <radical>dirt</radical> if you want to <kanji>cultivate</kanji> good crops there. Clowns act as a natural fertilizer, and this will make it super easy to cultivate any crops you could ever want in this dirt. Isn't nature amazing?
meaningInfo: Imagine burying a dead clown in the dirt and then planting some seeds on top. It's worth it, you think, if it helps cultivate your crops.
readingMnemonic: Before you can start this whole <kanji>cultivation</kanji> process however, you have to say <reading>bye</reading> (<ja>ばい</ja>) to the clown. Say bye to him, then bash his head in, and drop him in the dirt.
readingInfo: Saying bye is polite. Never forget to say bye, even in the middle of a cold-blooded clown murder.
